title: Flipped STEM Problem-Solving Skill Development Module

context.prior_knowledge: Basic STEM concepts and fundamental understanding of engineering problem-solving
context.additional_context: In a flipped learning environment based on Merrill’s instructional design principles, theoretical learning is conducted online in advance, with in-class time focused on practical problem-solving activities

learning_goals: Learners can self-directively acquire STEM theoretical content provided in a flipped learning environment with an 80%+ comprehension rate.
Learners can apply teamwork-based approaches to solve real engineering problems in problem-solving scenarios designed according to Merrill’s instructional design principles.
Learners can demonstrate complex STEM problem-solving abilities through project-based assessments.

resources: Collaboration tools (e.g., Google Workspace, Microsoft Teams)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
